sequence.notes: Oxidation of 2-isopropyl-5-methylthiophene to the corresponding sulfone using m-CPBA and sodium bicarbonate in dichloromethane.
Cheletropic elimination of SO2 from the thiophene S,S-dioxide to form a conjugated diene, followed by cycloaddition to yield two regioisomeric azulenes.
Vilsmeier-Haack formylation of two distinct azulene derivatives, yielding two corresponding formylated azulene products.

The reaction shows two reactant isomers, both azulene-1-carbaldehydes. The product structure shown is 1,7-diisopropyl-4-methylazulene. A standard Wolff-Kishner reduction (aldehyde to methyl group) applied to either reactant would yield a different product (1,8-dimethyl-4-isopropylazulene from the first reactant, or 1,4-dimethyl-7-isopropylazulene from the second reactant). The product shown in the image is also labelled 'Guaiazulene', which is typically 1,4-dimethyl-7-isopropylazulene, a structure that differs from the drawn product. Thus, there is a discrepancy between the drawn product structure, the labelled product name, and the stated reaction type given the reactants.
